titleproper.value: Guide to the Ronald L. Brown Collection on Early Instruction at the New York University School of Law  <num>MC.12</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Claire Wolford. Additional description by Deborah Shapiro.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-10-09T12:47:25</date>

unittitle.value: Ronald L. Brown Collection on Early Instruction at the New York University School of Law

abstract.value: Ronald L. Brown is Associate Director for Collection Services at the New York University School of Law and the author of The Law School Papers of Benjamin F. Butler: New York University School of Law in the 1830s.  The Ronald L. Brown Collection on Early Instruction at the New York University School of Law consists of material collected by Brown while conducting research on Butler.  The collection contains mainly photocopies of published material and typescript copies of manuscript correspondence documenting the history of instruction at the New York University School of Law in the early to mid 19th century.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); The Ronald L. Brown Collection on Early Instruction at the New York University School of Law; MC 12; box number; folder number; University Archives, New York University
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.  The accession number associated with this collection is 2019.110.

Ronald L. Brown is Associate Director for Collection Services at the New York University School of Law and the author of <emph render='italic'>The Law School Papers of Benjamin F. Butler: New York University School of Law in the 1830s</emph>.

The Ronald L. Brown Collection on Early Instruction at the New York University School of Law consists of photocopies of published material and typescript copies of manuscript correspondence documenting the history of instruction at the New York University School of Law in the early to mid 19th century.  These materials were compiled by Ronald L. Brown of NYU's Law Library and staff of the University Archives for Brown's book, <emph render='italic'>The Law School Papers of Benjamin F. Butler: New York University School of Law in the 1830s</emph>.  There is very little original material in this collection, the bulk being photocopies.  Material includes correspondence between Brown, Bayrd Still, and other University Archives staff in the early 1980s; summaries and typescripts of correspondence between Butler, Harriet Butler, J. M. Mathews, Martin Van Buren, H. D. Gilpin, and David Graham, Jr.; and clippings and published articles about Butler and the law school.

subject.value: Law --  Study and teaching -- United States.

corpname.value: New York University. School of Law
